body.p:
Shelbyville Ky Oct. 12th 1863
His Excellency Govr Bramlette
Dear Sir
In response to the request of the adjutant Genl of Ky., I write to recommend Thos B Cochran as a suitable person for Col in this County (Shelby)

He served upward of one year in Boards Cavalry as Lieut Col. resigned because of bad health, his health is now restored and he will serve, his experience is worth a great deal. He is a ^good^ lawyer of this place, clear headed & sound as a dollar. I begged him to accept the place. He consented to do so at my most urgent solicitation.
I want none but loyal, brave sober men on guard, & would not recomend any other sort to you for appointment.

I concur in the above
R F George Capt.
Provost Marshall of Shelby County

Shelby Coy Ky Oct 12/63
Recmdg from this Coy for Colonel of Militia Thos B Cochran Colonel
Z Wheat
R H George
Pro Marshall
